700741f-c.title: Bronx: City Island - the west shore of the island.
700741f-c.text:
City Island: Viewing toward the west shore of the island across Long Island Sound, from Rodmans Neck. Note the airplane on
the water.
May 29, 1928
P. L. Sperr
(2a
Viewing south from City Island Bridge.
July 6, 1936
P. L. Sperr
(3)
From the City Island end of the bridge.
July 6, 1936
P. L. Sperr

700741f-b.folder: City Island & the west shore of the island., Bronx, NY

701604f-b.text:
(1)
Pelham Bay Park: A view of Glover's Rock on the south side of City Island Road, slightly east of Pelham Bridge Road. Here began the Battle of Pell's Point under Colonel Glover, who held back the British long enough to allow Washington to reach White Plains. The tablet was erected on October 18, 1901 by the Daughters of the American Revolution, Mount Vernon, New York, Bronx chapter.
1908.
Gift of Randall Comfort.
(2)
The same, another view.
May 29, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
701604f-b.folder: City Island Road & Pelham Bridge Road, Bronx, NY
701604f-b.original_title: Bronx: City Island Road - Pelham Bridge Road
